poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: Lust will rob you of your innocence Age relieve you of your lust; Death of course will then assuage Or abrogate old age. Sort of. For innocence can outstare lust Which can defer or ridicule age And though death does for age and lust It can't touch innocence. Can't touch anything really: Its spurious personality looms In the death of innocent creatures.
